definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: She is a capable pilot, and a shrewd leader.
sentences.chinese: 她是出色的飞行员和贤明的领导者。

sentences.english: The King ruled his people well and wisely.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王贤明地统治着他的臣民。

sentences.english: Let us offer thanks to our protector, the wise and kind Athene.
sentences.chinese: 让我们来感谢我们的保佑者，贤明而仁慈的雅典娜神。

sentences.english: You're at risk of losing this last trace, this philosophical reserve.
sentences.chinese: 你就要冒失去这最后的痕迹，这一贤明保留地的风险。

sentences.english: The emperor was also a wise monarch, cherish just and loved just.
sentences.chinese: 皇上也是贤明君主了，惜才，爱才。

sentences.english: A wise man once said that a fool and his money are soon parted .
sentences.chinese: 一个贤明的人曾经说过愚人是留不住财富的。

sentences.english: King Gamani the Righteous invited his wise old teacher to live in the palace.
sentences.chinese: 正直的国王伽摩尼把他那位贤明的老师接到宫殿里住。

sentences.english: Better a slap from the wise than a kiss from a fool.
sentences.chinese: 宁可让贤明的人打一耳光，也不愿傻瓜来亲一口。

sentences.english: A wise ruler is generous in victory.
sentences.chinese: 贤明的统治者在胜利时能宽宏大量。

sentences.english: A judicious parent encourages his children to make their own decisions.
sentences.chinese: 贤明的父亲鼓励儿女自作抉择。

definition: Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
enlightened sage/brilliant master (flattering words applied to ruler)
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
